docs.snippet: “The Numbers Game” argues that much of the conventional wisdom in soccer, on subjects as varied as corner kicks and player signings, is wrong....
docs.lead_paragraph: “The Numbers Game” argues that much of the conventional wisdom in soccer, on subjects as varied as corner kicks and player signings, is wrong.
docs.abstract: Keeping Score column highlights book The Numbers Game, by former goalkeeper turned Ivy League statistical guru Chris Anderson and behavioral economist David Sally, who apply statistical analysis to challenge conventional wisdom in soccer.

headline.main: With New Book, Seeking Truth in Statistics of Soccer
headline.print_headline: Seeking Truth In Soccer With Statistics

docs.snippet: At the age of 89 President Robert Mugabe is on the campaign trail, seeking to extend his grip on Zimbabwe in an election next week that observers fear will be marred by fraud. But the opposition is gambling that there is enough discontent to unsea...
docs.lead_paragraph: At the age of 89 President Robert Mugabe is on the campaign trail, seeking to extend his grip on Zimbabwe in an election next week that observers fear will be marred by fraud. But the opposition is gambling that there is enough discontent to unseat the wily political survivor, who has been in power for 33 years.

headline.main: Zimbabwe Faces Poll With Little Violence This Time
headline.print_headline: Zimbabwe Faces Poll With Little Violence This Time
